page.title: 12LOCAL HOUSES (CONT.)
page.content: sandstone for the lower storey. The Old School was built in 1854 and is now used as the village hall for Womens Institute meetings,libray, whist drives,jumble sales,parties and a snooker club.The brick work shows a chequered pattern including Ashburnham blue brcks a local brick. The brick yard closed in 1968 after 12 years and was and was the last woodfired kiln in this country. The new school was opened in 1913 and provides education for the children from the surrounding villages of Ashburnham,Bodle Street and Dallington. There are approximately 110 children on roll.
